thread.title: What's Up With L.A.'s Housing Market?
thread.title_full: What's Up With L.A.'s Housing Market?

title: What's Up With L.A.'s Housing Market?
text:
Print Article Never mind a certain East Coast city — it turns out that Los Angeles is home to the most valuable housing market in the country. That means there are fewer affordable neighborhoods than ever; in fact, the hottest real estate neighborhood in the city was pretty accessible to average homebuyers just a few years. Yet despite L.A.'s high concentration of high-priced real estate, a disproportionate number of minority homeowners have underwater mortgages. Is there anything that can be done about that — and about the housing shortage that's driving the housing crisis? The articles below explore all of this and more. 
Angeleno home buyers this year are likely to continue to rediscover denser, more urban parts of the city. The latest Zillow Home Value Forecast names the hottest real estate neighborhood in L.A., and it's not a huge surprise. 
Read the full L.A. Weekly article here . These hills are alive with the sound of money.
